longitude: 15.869444 Kurentovanje Carnival https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurentovanje Kurentovanje can be viewed as a ritualized spring-welcoming celebration in which masked figures (kurenti) perform noisy
label: symbolic actions meant to drive away winter and ensure fertility and renewal for the coming year. Although today the festival is a large public carnival
column6: and procession—reflect older beliefs about seasonal transition and restoring balance to the community and natural world.

longitude: -3.393696162581412 Burryman's Parade - 2nd Friday in August https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Burryman The Burryman parade features a man completely covered in thousands of sticky burrs
label: walking awkwardly through South Queensferry supported by two flower-decorated poles
link: with attendants guiding him along a long route of pubs and homes. The purpose of the custom is traditionally said to bring good luck to the town
column5: with residents offering whisky and money to ensure the continuity of the ritual. #august
